citeinfo.origin: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources (DNR) - Ecological and Water Resources Division
citeinfo.title: Groundwater Management Areas, Minnesota

pubinfo.publish: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources, Ecological and Water Resources Division

descript.abstract: A Groundwater Management Area (GWMA) is the surface and subsurface area within which a GWMA Plan, approved by the commissioner of the Department of Natural Resources, is implemented in accordance with Minnesota Statute 103G.287, Subd. 4. The boundaries of a GWMA are delineated by identifiable physical features, Minnesota Department of Natural Resources Catchments, and/or political or administrative boundaries.
descript.purpose: To identify GWMA boundaries on maps or using GIS software.

place.placekey: North and East Metro, Bonanza Valley, Straight River, Minnesota

idinfo.useconst: Use of the data are constrained only by the DNR GIS Data License Agreement. See the Distribution Liability section below for a link.

timeperd.current: Time Period of Content Date indicates when dataset was last updated. The currentness of the geometry of source data sets varies widely.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).

horizpa.horizpar: No quantitative studies of horizontal positional accuracy exist for the watershed boundary source data. Although positional accuracy of watershed delineations can be arbitrary, accuracy of these data can be reasonably estimated based on the characteristics of all source materials and processing techniques to be 100 feet (30 meters) from correct position. The accuracy of the political and administrative boundary source data varies but is +/- 40 feet (12 meters) for most data.

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct using ArcGIS 10.2.

procstep.procdesc: The sources of boundary feature data include: DNR Hydrography Dataset (MNDNR) and City Township and Unorganized Territory (CTU) Boundaries Minnesota (MnGeo). See the Groundwater Management Area documentation for information on boundary feature selection.
